revised_title: Co-relation and its Measurement in Anthropometric Data
tldr: This article introduces the concept of co-relation, which refers to the variation of one variable being accompanied by more or less variation of another variable in the same direction. The author, Francis Galton, explains how co-relation is the consequence of the variations of two organs being partly due to common causes and discusses the different degrees of co-relation. He also provides examples from anthropometric data.
